and expression syntax in the page to display related
Incorrect. You cannot access child record information using only a standard controller. You need to use a controller extension.
and cross-object formula fields on the
Incorrect. Cross-object formula fields cannot access child records, only the parent fields.
and cross-object formula fields on the
Incorrect. Cross-object formula fields cannot access child records, only the parent fields.

Correct. A controller extension is the way to query the Review child records while keeping the standard controller functionality.

2. Re-position all the items back into the fluid boxes (drag until box turns green).
3. From the last slide, copy and paste the three items to the appropriate emply fluid boxes.
4. Click each of the three items and ensure the labels (in Properties tab) are as follows:
What are two capabilities of a StandardSetController? (Select two answers.)
It allows pages to perform mass updates of records.

Correct. The StandardSetController class also contains a prototype object. This is a single sObject contained within the StandardSetController class. If the prototype object's fields are set, those values are used during the save action, meaning that the values are applied to every record in the set controller's collection. This is useful for writing pages that perform mass updates.
It allows pages to perform pagination with large record sets.
Correct. StandardSetControllers have built-in pagination that helps reduce the number of records displayed on the page.
It extends the functionality of a standard or custom controller.
Incorrect. Controller extension classes are the ones that extend the functionality of a standard or custom controller.
It enforces field-level security when reading large record sets.
Incorrect. The StandardSetController does not enforce field-level security.
A Visualforce page has a standard controller for an object that has a lookup relationship to a parent object. How can a developer display data from the parent record on the page?
Use SOQL on the Visualforce page to query for data from the parent record.
Incorrect. You would need a controller extension to query for the parent data. It is unnecessary since you can use merge field syntax.
Add a second standard controller to the page for the parent record.
Incorrect. You cannot have two standard controllers on a page.
Use a roll-up formula field on the child record to include data from the parent record.
Incorrect. Roll-up formula fields are used to retrieve summarized data from child records when the relationship is master detail. In this case we need the parent record’s information.
Use merge field syntax to retrieve data from the parent record.
Correct. You can use related merged fields to get the data from the parent record. The relative fields are prepended to __r.
What are two reasons that a developer should use a custom Visualforce page in a Lightning Platform application? (Select two answers.)
To generate a PDF document with application data
Correct. Currently a Visualforce page is required to render a PDF document.
To create components for dashboards and layouts
Correct. You can embed a Visualforce page anywhere in your Salesforce dashboard as a standard component.
To deploy components between two organizations
Incorrect. You can do this using the standard Salesforce UI.
To modify the page layout settings for a custom object
Incorrect. You can do this using the standard Salesforce UI.
A developer needs to create records for the object

. The developer creates the following code block. Which line of code should the developer insert at line 03 to ensure that at least some records are created, even if a few records have errors and fail to be created?
Incorrect. If there are errors while inserting any of the records, the insert will fail.

Correct. This stems from the method Database.insert(recordToInsert, allOrNone) where 'allOrNone' is a Boolean value. If the Boolean value is set to false and a record fails, the remainder of the DML operation will succeed. If it's set to true an exception is thrown if the method is not completely successful.
Incorrect. System.ALLOW_PARTIAL is not a valid parameter inside this method.
Incorrect. If there are errors while inserting any of the records the insert will fail.
